A-dynamic-jitter-buffer.label: Dynamic Jitter Buffers
A-dynamic-jitter-buffer.help: Dynamically buffer client audio based on perceived jitter in packet receipt timing

B-static-desired-jitter-buffer-frames.label: Static Desired Jitter Buffer Frames
B-static-desired-jitter-buffer-frames.help: If dynamic jitter buffers is disabled, this determines the target number of frames maintained by the AudioMixer's jitter buffers

C-max-frames-over-desired.label: Max Frames Over Desired
C-max-frames-over-desired.help: The highest number of frames an AudioMixer's ringbuffer can exceed the desired jitter buffer frames by

D-use-stdev-for-desired-calc.label: Use Stdev for Desired Jitter Frames Calc:
D-use-stdev-for-desired-calc.help: If checked, Philip's method (stdev of timegaps) is used to calculate desired jitter frames. Otherwise, Fred's method (max timegap) is used

E-window-starve-threshold.label: Window Starve Threshold
E-window-starve-threshold.help: If this many starves occur in an N-second window (N is the number in the next field), then the desired jitter frames will be re-evaluated using Window A.

F-window-seconds-for-desired-calc-on-too.label: Timegaps Window (A) Seconds:
F-window-seconds-for-desired-calc-on-too.help: Window A contains a history of timegaps. Its max timegap is used to re-evaluate the desired jitter frames when too many starves occur within it.

G-window-seconds-for-desired-reduction.label: Timegaps Window (B) Seconds:
G-window-seconds-for-desired-reduction.help: Window B contains a history of timegaps. Its max timegap is used as a ceiling for the desired jitter frames value.

H-repetition-with-fade.label: Repetition with Fade:
H-repetition-with-fade.help: If enabled, dropped frames and mixing during starves will repeat the last frame, eventually fading to silence

Z-unattenuated-zone.label: Unattenuated Zone
Z-unattenuated-zone.help: Boxes for source and listener (corner x, corner y, corner z, size x, size y, size z, corner x, corner y, corner z, size x, size y, size z)
